intro: Lathraeocarpa acicularis, commonly known as the needlefruit, is a rare and unusual plant species native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, needle-like fruits that develop from the base of its leafy stems. The plant belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. Its small, elongated fruits are typically green when mature and may contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Lathraeocarpa acicularis is considered a botanical curiosity and is of interest to researchers studying plant adaptation in extreme environments.
